review_title: It's a family here.  We help each other.
job_title: Student Associate in New York, NY
pros: Close to the train station and conveniently located in Downtown Manhattan
cons: The benefit package is not great.

job_title: Senior Admissions Counselor in New York, NY
pros: Amazing people to work with in all departments
cons: Upper management cant seem to get it together and will be the reason this school closes.

job_title: Collections Manager in New York, NY
pros: Great stepping stone for anyone just starting
cons: No raises, high turnover, high student debt

review_title: Good entry level higher ed experience
job_title: Enrollment Representative in New York, NY
pros: In person/work from home flexibility, PTO, own office space
cons: Salary, upper management, unpredictability of college’s future

job_title: Adjunct Professor in New York, NY
pros: great intetaction with the students and staff.
cons: The working hours can be erratic and unpredictable.

review_title: "That's the way we've always done it..."
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Some people are really wonderful to work with. Some people are flexible and WANT to collaborate. Some people want to see me succeed.
cons: Leadership is ineffective, lacks vision, disorganized, and doesn't value the needs of students, only their money! Enrollment driven, which doesn't make for a calm working environment. Micromanaged. Turn over rate in my department is EXCESSIVE. Employee morale is almost always low. Treated unfairly. not given professional development, inside or outside. Nothing is ever good enough. "That's just the way it is..." is the leaderships fav line. The dean of students doesn't see students, talk to students, or come out of the office to interact.

job_title: Enrollment Specialist in New York, NY
pros: The people who work here are great. They are like family. They know when to work and they know how to have fun. Expect to make great friends. The students come from so many backgrounds and circumstances and tend to skew on the older side. You have to respect their decision to better themselves, oftentimes while working full time. They have a level of determination and drive and I envy.
cons: The busiest times for admissions is right around the holidays and at the end of August. It can be difficult to schedule vacation time.

review_title: Great stepping stone but their isn't much incentive offered for personal development and growth
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Lenient with scheduling, receive paid holidays off.
cons: There is not much room for growth and when an opportunity presents itself the environment turns into a dog eat dog world.

pros: Great place to work  . a place where you can grow and excell if you really want to. you can go far here
cons: Coworkers can be very childlike and petty. some of the people are all about themselves and their success and will knock u out of the way to make it to the top.

pros: I believe there are opportunities for the professors that wish to be involved in administration.  Working with the deans can create a full time position for those desiring an administrative track.
cons: The students are under prepared for  master level work.  As a result, one works doubly hard to bring the students up to par.

job_title: Academic and Student Life Advisor in Riverdale, NY
pros: Curriculum is unique and really prepares students for careers in their field!
cons: No professional development Very high turn over rate. Poor leadership - more like having orders barked at you. Nobody works together.

job_title: Admission Assistant in New York, NY
pros: nice school and great staff, meeting new students and attending the school at the same time.
cons: the student workers do not always feel appreciated and should have an appreciationday.

job_title: Student Support/Front Desk Administrator in New York, NY
pros: Inside view into school administrative operations
cons: money hungry institution that does not hold its students body in a favorable light, nor does the school staff hold much hope for the future of its students.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in New York, NY
pros: Teaching One on One to One versus online.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: This school has the most unique students in NYC. Smart, driven and success-oriented.
cons: Everything else. Why do adjuncts get paid next to nothing and, yet, teach every core class?
